definitions.example: So let's see. There are two evens here and three odds.

definitions.definition: Something left over, not forming part of a set.
Differing from what is usual, ordinary or expected.
definitions.example: She slept in, which was very odd.

definitions.definition: Without a corresponding mate in a pair or set; unmatched; (of a pair or set) mismatched.
definitions.example: My cat Fluffy has odd eyes: one blue and one brown.

definitions.definition: Left over, remaining after the rest have been paired or grouped.
Left over or remaining (as a small amount) after counting, payment, etc.
Scattered; occasional, infrequent; not forming part of a set or pattern.
definitions.example: I don't speak Latin well, so in hearing a dissertation in Latin, I would only be able to make out the odd word of it.

definitions.definition: Used or employed for odd jobs.

definitions.example: The product of odd numbers is also odd.
How do I print only the odd pages?

definitions.definition: (in combination with a number) About, approximately; somewhat more than (an approximated round number).
definitions.example: There were thirty-odd people in the room.
He served from the odd court.

definitions.definition: Singular in excellence; matchless; peerless; outstanding.
